chapter.title: Basic Concepts and Work Styles
chapter.para: Best practices describe how to set up projects and work with your own or other sources and should be known by every OBS user.

sect1.title: Setting Up a Project Re-Using Other Project's Binaries
Setting up a project reusing other project sources
sect1.para: It is possible to include the sources, spec files, and patches from another project in your current project using: #osc branch

sect1.title: Contributing to Projects
sect1.para:
New users to a given project may contribute code:
1. Copy the package source 2. Make changes 3. Submit the source containing your changes to the project.
When code is accepted it is merged with the project . When code is declined, it remains available for revision and submission.
Wiki reference: User comment page

sect1.tittle:
Contributing to Projects
After successfully merging code into a project and building trust with the package owners, it is possible to request maintainer permissions. This allows direct commits to the project without reveue.
# osc createrequest -a add_me maintainer PROJECT
